text: Alain Touraine (; 3 August 1925 - 9 June 2023) was a French sociologist. He was the research director at the École des hautes études en sciences sociales. He founded the Centre d'étude des mouvements sociaux. He was best known for being the originator of the term "post-industrial society". He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1990. Touraine died in Paris, France on 9 June 2023, at the age of 97. ==References== ==Other websites== * Answers.com on Alain Touraine * Jacques Hamel compares aspects of Pierre Bourdieu and Alain Touraine * Comments of Touraine at Forum Barcelona 2004 Category:1925 births Category:2023 deaths Category:French sociologists Category:Members of Academia Europaea
